column4: Sorry. My bad. Um, where does electricsheep install into? I know it's supposed to be into my home folder, but I can't find it. I've downloaded it and installed it with apt-get, but it won't download a sheep. I got a sheep pack but I don't know where to extract it to.
It is installed cuz if I run it from the CLI it tries to download a sheep, but won't connect to the network
I just apt-get it a couple minutes ago too.
Yeah, that worked. But I have a multitude of files.
Same results. Which directory would contain the sheep files?
the p2p-ness of electric sheep only goes while the screensaver is running
and it takes a long time. probably best to just download a sheep-pack yourself and put it in ~/.sheep
if you set electric sheep as your screensaver and have no sheep yet, itll jsut be solid black until however many days/weeks it takes to get sheep
so turn on hidden files in your file browser (in the view menu)
it might not exist yet. in that case, make a new folder named ".sheep" in your home directory
